name: portability
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the quality of being light and small enough to be easily carried or moved: The advantage of the smaller model is its greater portability. Campers like food pouches for their portability and long shelf lives.
the quality of being able to be taken with you if you move to a different place or job: There is a need for pension portability, to enable workers to take whatever pension credits they earn from job to job. Health-savings accounts have been touted for their portability from job to job. See
portable
More examplesFewer examplesA projector's portability is important when you're carrying it through airport security.Business travelers like the portability of jump drives like these.Until recently, pension portability wasn't a big issue because so many teachers started and finished their careers in one system.Number portability allows customers to keep their cellphone number when they change carriers.
